message.name: Life
message.text: Jean Marie Vianney was born in Dardilly in the Rhone in 1786. Jean Marie Vianney made his first communion in the neighboring village of Écully in 1799. He worked the land with his father. In October 1809, Jean Marie Vianney was called to the army. Jean Marie Vianney was accepted at the seminary of Verrières in 1811.

message.name: Credo

test.input: What is the credo?
test.output: The credo is "I believe in God, the Father Almighty, Creator of heaven and earth. And in Jesus Christ, his only Son, our Lord: who was conceived by the Holy Spirit, born of the Virgin Mary, suffered under Pontius Pilate, was crucified, died, and was buried; he descended into hell; the third day he rose again from the dead; he ascended into heaven; sitteth at the right hand of God the Father Almighty; from thence he shall come to judge the living and the dead. I believe in the Holy Spirit, the holy Catholic Church, the communion of Saints, the forgiveness of sins, the resurrection of the body, and life everlasting. Amen.".

message.text: The credo is "I believe in God, the Father Almighty, Creator of heaven and earth. And in Jesus Christ, his only Son, our Lord: who was conceived by the Holy Spirit, born of the Virgin Mary, suffered under Pontius Pilate, was crucified, died, and was buried; he descended into hell; the third day he rose again from the dead; he ascended into heaven; sitteth at the right hand of God the Father Almighty; from thence he shall come to judge the living and the dead. I believe in the Holy Spirit, the holy Catholic Church, the communion of Saints, the forgiveness of sins, the resurrection of the body, and life everlasting. Amen."

message.name: How can Sacred Scripture be “truth” if not everything in it is right?

test.input: How can Sacred Scripture be “truth” if not everything in it is right?
test.output: The Bible is not meant to convey precise historical information or scientific findings to us. Moreover, the authors were children of their time. Their forms of expression are influenced by the sometimes inadequate cultural images of the world around them. Nevertheless, everything that man must know about God and the way of his salvation is found with infallible certainty in Sacred Scripture.

message.name: What significance does the New Testament have for Christians?

test.input: What significance does the New Testament have for Christians?
test.output: I don't know what the significance does the New Testament has for christians.

trigger.value: What significance does the New Testament have for Christians?

message.text: In the New Testament God’s Revelation is completed. The four Gospels according to Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John are the centerpiece of Sacred Scripture and the most precious treasure of the Church. In them the Son of God shows himself as he is and encounters us. In the Acts of the Apostles we learn about the beginnings of the Church and the working of the Holy Spirit. In the letters written by the apostles, all facets of human life are set in the light of Christ. In the Book of Revelation we foresee the end of the ages.

message.name: What significance does the Old Testament have for Christians?

test.input: What significance does the Old Testament have for Christians?
test.output: In the Old Testament God reveals himself as the Creator and preserver of the world and as the leader and instructor of mankind. The Old Testament books are also God’s Word and Sacred Scripture. Without the Old Testament, we cannot understand Jesus.
test.outputReferences:
Catechism of the Catholic Church n° ; ;
Source:

test.output: Yes. Human reason can know God with certainty.

trigger.value: Can we know the existence of God by our reason?

message.name: Why do people deny that God exists, if they can know him by reason?

test.input: Why do people deny that God exists, if they can know him by reason?
test.output: I don't know why people deny if God can know himself by the reason then he exists.

trigger.value: Why do people deny that God exists, if they can know him by reason?

message.text: To know the invisible God is a great challenge for the human mind. Many are scared off by it. Another reason why some do not want to know God is because they would then have to change their life. Anyone who says that the question about God is meaningless because it cannot be answered is making things too easy for himself.

message.name: Why do we seek God?

test.input: Why do we seek God?
test.output: God has placed in our hearts a longing to seek and find him. St. Augustine says, "You have made us for yourself, and our heart is restless until it rests in you." We call this longing for God religion.
test.outputReferences:
Bible verses:
Catechism of the Catholic Church n°
Source:

trigger.value: Why do we seek God?

message.text: God has placed in our hearts a longing to seek and find him. St. Augustine says, "You have made us for yourself, and our heart is restless until it rests in you." We call this longing for God religion.

message.name: Faith - what is it?

test.input: What is faith?
test.output:
Faith is knowledge and trust. It has seven characteristics: \hc_resource_html=#en_US#
  • Faith is a sheer gift of God, which we receive when we fervently ask for it.
  • Faith is the supernatural power that is absolutely necessary if we are to attain salvation.
  • Faith requires the free will and clear understanding of a person when he accepts the divine invitation.
  • Faith is absolutely certain, because Jesus guarantees it.
  • Faith is incomplete unless it leads to active love.
  • Faith grows when we listen more and more carefully to God’s Word and enter a lively exchange with him in prayer.
  • Faith gives us even now a foretaste of the joy of heaven.
\
test.outputReferences:
Catechism of the Catholic Church n° ; ;
Source:

trigger.value: What is faith?

message.text:
Faith is knowledge and trust. It has seven characteristics:
  • Faith is a sheer gift of God, which we receive when we fervently ask for it.
  • Faith is the supernatural power that is absolutely necessary if we are to attain salvation.
  • Faith requires the free will and clear understanding of a person when he accepts the divine invitation.
  • Faith is absolutely certain, because Jesus guarantees it.
  • Faith is incomplete unless it leads to active love.
  • Faith grows when we listen more and more carefully to God’s Word and enter a lively exchange with him in prayer.
  • Faith gives us even now a foretaste of the joy of heaven.

message.name: Believing in God, how does that work?

trigger.value: Believing in God, how does that work?

message.text: Believing in God means: I put all my trust in him who loves me most. I accept what God reveals about himself. I try to do what he tells me.

message.name: Believing in God, how does that work? (continuation)
message.text: Believing in God means being safe and secure with him. God loves us. We do not need to be afraid. With him, we can bring out the best in ourselves!

message.name: Can I talk to God?

Source:

trigger.value: Can I talk to God?

message.text: Yes. Talk to him! Ask him to make himself known in your heart.

message.name: Can I talk to God? (continuation)
message.text: Not only can you talk to God, God is already waiting for you. It does not matter if you are riding your bike or waiting for a bus. Just talk to him.

message.name: Can we believe whatever we want?

test.input: Can we believe whatever we want?
test.output: I don't know if we can believe that that we want.

trigger.value: Can we believe whatever we want?

message.text: Yes, but only the truth is worth believing. Christians do not invent the faith; they trust in Jesus Christ. He has brought us the truth about God. It is written in the Bible and in the living Tradition of the Church.

message.name: Can we believe whatever we want? (continuation)
message.text: In the Church, together we live out what we have learned from Jesus. We should bring this faith to all people. Even though God is close to everyone, he asks us to share our faith with each other.

message.name: Can we know God?

test.input: Can we know God?
test.output: Yes, but not without his help. God is greater than all of our images and all of our thoughts. God is a great mystery.
test.outputReferences: Source: <hc_source name="YOUCAT for Kids" resourceid="can-we-know-god" textlength="15" />

trigger.value: Can we know God?

message.text: Yes, but not without his help. God is greater than all of our images and all of our thoughts. God is a great mystery.

message.name: Can we know God? (continuation)
message.text: God wants us to know and love him. That is why he shows himself to us. That is called "revelation".

message.name: How do we know that God exists?

test.input: How do we know that God exists?
test.output: We know that God exists because we see his traces everywhere.
test.outputReferences:
Bible verses:
Source:

trigger.value: How do we know that God exists?

message.text: We know that God exists because we see his traces everywhere.

message.name: How do we know that God exists? (continuation)
message.text: Look at everything: the sun in the sky, the stars at night, the forests, the mountains, the seas, and the rivers, the big animals and the small, the people on all the continents. God has made all that.

message.name: How is knowledge about God passed on?

test.input: How is knowledge about God passed on?
test.output: I don't know how knowledge passed on is about God.

message.text: Among God's people, from the beginning, knowledge of God was passed on through stories about him, which were written down in the Bible. They are celebrated at Mass and proclaimed by the Church.

message.name: How is knowledge about God passed on? (continuation 2)
message.text: Sometimes we learn about God from the experiences of others. When Christians recount the ways God has showed himself to them, guided them in their lives, or healed them, they give witness to their faith.

message.name: How is knowledge about God passed on? (continuation)
message.text: The Church is the community where experiences with the living God are correctly understood and passed on from generation to generation. Every Christian who lives by his faith has a story to tell. Christian parents and grandparents try to pass on their faith to their children and grandchildren.

message.name: Where does the world and everything that is come from ?

trigger.value: Where does the world and everything that is come from ?

message.text: Everything that is comes from God.

message.name: Why do I exist?

test.input: Why do I exist?
test.output: You are here because God wants you.
test.outputReferences: Source: <hc_source name="YOUCAT for Kids" resourceid="why-do-i-exist" textlength="15" />
